title: nuugeet435r
author: nuugeet435r
content: I am using ravan coin, i system reset my computer.i have 12 key phase, but i forgot my passphase extension! or was it the ordering?? idk, my passphase is screwed!I have recovered my wallet.dat file using anyrecover softwaresadly i think i may have corrupted it because i intalled ravan client, and launched it, which may have wrote on the same space as the old wallet datplz help mei used py wallet and it gives error : Couldn't open wallet.dat/main try quitting bitcoin and running this againplz help me

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: First of all, i would recommend you to stop using your laptop/computer to prevent more file overwritten and create live USB (for example https://clonezilla.org/liveusb.php) to make raw copy of your HDD or SSD. After that, you can perform recovery based on that raw copy.Although since you use Windows 10, have you checked whether Windows keep previous version of your wallet file? Check this guide if you don't know what i'm talking about, https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/79490-restore-previous-versions-files-folders-drives-windows-10-a.html.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: oh dear I understand your that losing access to your passphrase can be stressful. I have not experienced such issue but i think taking the following steps will be helpful. Before doing any more recovery first of make a backup of your current wallet.dat file to avoid accidental data loss. checkout in the raven community https://ravencoin.org/community/ if anyone faces similar issue. Maybe someone solved same issue. Review the configuration settings of Py Wallet. Try to update the wallet to to new one.

comments.author: nuugeet435r
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on December 12, 2023, 09:06:00 AMFirst of all, i would recommend you to stop using your laptop/computer to prevent more file overwritten and create live USB (for example https://clonezilla.org/liveusb.php) to make raw copy of your HDD or SSD. After that, you can perform recovery based on that raw copy.Although since you use Windows 10, have you checked whether Windows keep previous version of your wallet file? Check this guide if you don't know what i'm talking about, https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/79490-restore-previous-versions-files-folders-drives-windows-10-a.html.I have 0 backup

comments.author: nuugeet435r
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on December 12, 2023, 09:06:00 AMFirst of all, i would recommend you to stop using your laptop/computer to prevent more file overwritten and create live USB (for example https://clonezilla.org/liveusb.php) to make raw copy of your HDD or SSD. After that, you can perform recovery based on that raw copy.Although since you use Windows 10, have you checked whether Windows keep previous version of your wallet file? Check this guide if you don't know what i'm talking about, https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/79490-restore-previous-versions-files-folders-drives-windows-10-a.html.Idk how to use py wallet, i tried using it and it give me error, invalid format.I have shut down my computerI used AnyRecover and still able to get my wallet.dat but when i try to run it, it says corrupted.What should i do now??

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Quote from: nuugeet435r on December 12, 2023, 08:18:18 AMi have 12 key phase, but i forgot my passphase extension! or was it the ordering?? idk, my passphase is screwed!plz help meIt's so unfortunate you have to find yourself in this tight mess losing ones asset is so painful only those that have had such experience will understand how it feels to be there at the moment. It is for the prevention of this stress and confusion you are into right now that we always lay emphasis on the best measures to secure and store our private keys. Like the infamous statement, "prevention is better than cure". Just for in case of next time and if you get fortunate to recovering your private keys I think you will be needing this informations from these threads below for your benefit to avoid this from happening next time.How best to secure your Private Keys and/or Seed phrasehttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5211880.0bitcoin private key storagehttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5387708.0Metal Bitcoin seed storage reviewshttps://jlopp.github.io/metal-bitcoin-storage-reviews/

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: There are many ways that things can go wrong running a crypto wallet on a computer, that's why I don't want to take the chances, there was a time that I had no choice but it was a painful experience, my PC kept getting different malware even when I was very careful.The crazy part are those crypto coins that have no support on popular crypto wallet and I have to download their software and install all their blockchain data, one moment they work well and the other they have syncing problem, it was never a pleasant experience.This is why I avoid any crypto project that's not available in other common crypto wallets like Trust wallet or Other multi-crypto wallet, trying to store keys can be much complicated, its better to get recovery seed off them and write it down somewhere instead.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: nuugeet435r on December 12, 2023, 01:00:52 PMQuote from: ETFbitcoin on December 12, 2023, 09:06:00 AM--snip--Idk how to use py wallet, i tried using it and it give me error, invalid format.Which pywallet do you use? If you used this one (https://github.com/jackjack-jj/pywallet), there's no indication it support wallet created by Ravan client/software. Quote from: nuugeet435r on December 12, 2023, 01:00:52 PMI have shut down my computerI used AnyRecover and still able to get my wallet.dat but when i try to run it, it says corrupted.What should i do now??At this point, usually it's time to ask Ravan community or developer of Ravan client/software how to manually extract private keey/seed from corrupted file.
